textList.name: START_BEACON_NEBULA
textList.text: This nebula must have been an important hub at one point; placing all of these jump beacons would be no easy task. However, now it's hardly navigable.
Nebulas were always dangerous places. Many electronics fail in these clouds. You will have to tread lightly.
You've entered a sector thick with nebulas. You'll have to navigate on instinct.
You've entered a nebula-rich sector. You may put a few light years on the fleet, but that's only useful if you make it out the other side.
Thanks to the high nebula density of this sector very little of it has been charted, and rumours of what lurks in the depths abound.
The gases that make up the nebulas in this sector threaten to impair your systems; but you have to press on.

You've reached an uncharted nebula. The outside environment won't be so pleasant for the pursuing Fleet, but don't rejoice just yet — this also applies to you. Try to reach the exit to the next area without having on-board sensors activated.
The only reference points in this sector are the high-frequency electromagnetic pulses of the jump beacons. Who knows who else these beacons may attract?..
A strong magnetic storm rages in this nebula. It'd probably be best to turn off sensitive sensor systems, otherwise you risk losing them until the very end of your mission.
Electronics breakdown, sensors failure, and much more await you on this course...
This sector is densely packed with nebulae. Well, at least this will give you a good chance to collect more resources. Just don't forget about the Rebels...
The good news is that you can easily lose the Rebels in the nebula. The bad news is that you can just as easily get in trouble...
As soon as you enter the nebula, the sensor system fails. It's encouraging that Rebel pursuit will be slower here. But that's about it... You'll have to try to find a way out of here.
The uncharted nebula isn't a place you want to stay in for long. Try to find a way out of here as soon as possible.

event.name: FLEET_EASY_NEBULA
event.text: An advanced Rebel hunter easily found your ship. You can't see it through the nebula, but you can assume the fleet is right on top of you. You need to escape quickly.

textList.name: NEBULA_STORE
textList.text: Some brave entrepreneurs set up a station here to extract elements from the nebula. There seems to be a public shipyard and rest stop here as well.
Seeing a trade depot set up near the beacon implies there is an alien settlement on some nearby rock. You decide to check out their wares.
The centre of a hydrogen cloud doesn't seem like a very usual place for a store, but the Engi aren't a usual species. Wouldn't hurt to take a look.
An Engi cargo vessel hails: "Propose mutually beneficial exchange of properties." That smells like a bargain.

You discover a cluster of Federation refugee ships taking shelter in the folds of the nebula. "I'm sorry we've got nothing to give you, but we need scrap to keep the engines running." You sense they'll strike a trade.

textList.name: NEBULA_EMPTY_LIST
textList.text: You can't see anything through the thick gases surrounding your ship. Without knowing what is out there, all you can do is wait for your FTL to charge.
Without active sensors you have no other option but to look out of the view-ports in apprehension. It's eerily quiet.
As you wait for the FTL drive to charge, you half expect to be ambushed at any moment. However, no attack comes...
You feel naked without functioning sensors. You half expect a Rebel ship to appear from behind a cloud at any moment, but none come.
Your crew are constantly looking out of the windows, checking for hostiles. They jump at every creak and moan of the ship. The tension is almost palpable...
You nervously glance out the windows but the only thing to greet you is more clouds and silence.
You cycle through wide-band comm channels as soon as you arrive. Nothing but static.
With the sensors down, you spend a good deal of time staring out the window. It is, you must admit, rather beautiful here.
There's nothing here, save for vast swirls of gas reflecting rays from a distant sun.

textList.name: NEBULA_REBEL_LIST
textList.text: You cross paths with an advance scout of the Rebel fleet searching this section of the nebula for your ship.
A ship bearing Rebel colors can be seen waiting near the beacon. They must have been waiting for you, since they engage immediately.
The Rebels must have anticipated you would try to lose them within the nebula. A scout is waiting for you at the beacon.
It looks like you will be unable to avoid the Rebels by traveling through the nebula. A Rebel ship is waiting for you near the beacon.
Shortly after you arrive, a Rebel ship jumps nearby. There looks to be no escape. Prepare for a fight!
Newton-knows what brings this Rebel ship so far out; its captain hails, but does a double take when he identifies your ship. They open fire.
A Rebel ship hails, but you don't take chances in conditions like this. You block the frequency and prepare to engage.

textList.name: NEBULA_AUTO_LIST
textList.text: You cross paths with an advance scout of the Rebel fleet searching this section of the nebula for your ship.
You jump into a calmer part of the nebula. However, your relief fades as a Rebel scout jumps to the beacon and moves in to attack.
The tangled wrecks of many ships wait in dormancy here. You see lights flicker on what looks like debris. A Rebel scout bursts out of the wreckage!
This drone isn't looking for you. Perhaps it's scouting ahead for the Rebel expansion or maybe they're seeking to use this nebula for cover. Regardless, it identifies you as hostile.
It's worrying that the Rebels have penetrated so deep into uncharted space, even if it is only an unmanned craft. It arms its weapons; you should do the same.

event.name: NEBULA_AUTO_WARNING
event.text: It appears that an automated Rebel scout was positioned within the nebula to warn of your passing.

textList.name: NEBULA_PIRATE
textList.text: As you drift through the nebula an unmarked vessel descends from the clouds and into your wake. Their weapons come online.
A pirate ship pulls out of the ether and hails: "You know what I love about this part of the galaxy? The explorers! You always carry such fine loot." They lock weapons.
As you coast through the nebula a pirate ship matches your course and closes the distance. Better to pick your battleground, but beggars can't be choosers.
A hostile vessel descends from out of the nebula. Combat stations!
You try to read the ID of a ship ahead in the fog, but it's too thick to penetrate. You have your answer when the ship turns, weapons hot!

textList.name: NEBULA_MANTIS_FIGHT
textList.text: Nebulas are known to be popular Mantis hunting grounds. Information you would have done well to heed here.
You detect a Mantis expedition vessel returning home with its haul. So determined are they, in fact, that they don't wait to see if you're hostile before firing.
A Mantis ship, lost in the storm, hails you. "Sensors are out. We have no local telemetry. We will take yours." You detect a power increase in their weapons systems.
A Mantis ship hails you through the storm: "These are sacred Urggghtnag clan hunting grounds. You are prey." Shields up!
You notice a Mantis attack ship ducking between the clouds of swirling space stuff; it's hunting you. You try to get the jump and move in to attack.

event.name: NEBULA_REBEL_UNDETECTED
event.text: Your ship emerges quite far away from the beacon. You see a Rebel ship waiting nearby, undoubtedly stationed to look for you.
You use your cloaking system to slip further into the nebula undetected.
You immediately slip further into the clouds, but not quickly enough. The Rebel catches sight of you and moves in to engage!

choice.text: (Improved Engines) Fully power the engines to out-run them.

event.text: Your powerful engines allow you to out-distance the ship and eventually lose it within the nebula.
You power down non-essential systems and slip into the cloud. The ship never noticed you.
The ship spots you and gives chase. After some quick maneuvering you were able to lose your pursuers in the clouds. You expect they warned the fleet of your position, however.

event.name: NEBULA_PIRATE_SMUGGLE
event.text: A pirate ship arrives shortly after you. Judging from the fact that it is attempting to avoid your ship, you assume that it's a smuggler trying to stay away from beacons.
You power up your weapons and move in to engage.
It jumps away after a time.

choice.text: (Advanced Weapons) Activate your advanced weapons threateningly.

event.text: They hail you, "There's no need for aggression... Perhaps this would convince you to look the other way?"

event.name: NEBULA_AUTO_DEFENSE_ITEM
event.text: An advance Rebel automated ship remains stationed near a small Rebel space-station. However, without functioning sensors it is impossible to tell what is inside.

choice.text: Attack the automated ship to get to the station.
(Cloaking) Attempt to stealthily access the space station.
(Improved Cloaking) Attempt to stealthily access the space station.

event.text: You successfully sneak by the ship and access the station undetected.

choice.text: (Hacking) Try to hack the station to prevent an alert.
(Improved Hacking) Hack the station to prevent an alert.

event.text: You successfully hack into the station and sever the connection to the automated ship, accessing the station completely undetected.
You successfully sneak by the ship and access the station undetected.
You try to sneak past the automated ship but it quickly turns and attacks!
You successfully hack into the station and sever the connection to the automated ship. You access the station undetected.
You send a drone to hack the station but the automated ship notices and turns to attack!

event.name: NEBULA_LOST_SHIP
event.text: A heavily damaged Federation ship is hiding in the nebula at this beacon. Before you have time to make contact with them, they fade into the nebula.

choice.text: Attempt to follow and help them.
Keep your position, they can handle themselves.
(Teleporter) Lock onto their life-signs with your teleporter.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Pump extra power into your sensors and try to track them.

event.text: Your search is hopeless. Your sensors can't pick up anything in the nebula.
While searching fruitlessly through the nebula, you stumble upon the Rebel ship which the Federation loyalists were likely hiding from. You prepare for a fight.
You get lucky and find them floating not too deep into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.

Your local radar flickers, periodically showing signs of a large object in the clouds nearby. However it's enough to get coordinates and you find the ship... an empty hull, long since stripped of functioning components.
You follow the faint signatures and find them floating not too far away into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.
You follow the faint signatures and find them floating not too far away into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.
You beam the Federation crew aboard. One gladly joins your crew, the rest wait to be dropped off at the next station.
You beam the Federation crew aboard. One gladly joins your crew, the rest wait to be dropped off at the next station.
As soon as you prepare the teleporter, the sensors lose the signal, and you're back to flying alone through the thick nebula...

event.name: NEBULA_WEAPONS_TRADER
event.text: A black market weapons trader spins you something unintelligible about the dangers lurking in the nebula before pushing his wares in front of you.

choice.text: Purchase an unknown weapon for 35 scrap.
(Slug Crewmember) Your Slug anticipates the outcome of the transaction...
(Mind Control) Convince him to make it a better deal.

event.text: You transfer the scrap and receive a weapon in return. Let's hope it was worth it.
You transfer the scrap and receive a weapon in return. Let's hope it was worth it.
You transfer over the scrap, but he reneges on the agreement. "I told you this was a dangerous place!"

choice.text: Having learned a valuable lesson, move on.

event.text: Once "convinced" to help he lowers the price and describes the weapon. However, he eventually comes to his senses and confusedly takes back his discount. He is clearly unsure why he offered it in the first place.
You purchase the weapon and thank him for his help.
You thank him for his offer and prepare to move on.

Once "convinced" to help, he casually states that his offer was actually a lie and that they planned to attack your ship. By the time he returns to his senses you've already prepared your ship to fight.
Once "convinced" to help he agrees to make a slight discount and shows you a weapon.
You purchase the weapon and thank him for his help.
You thank him for his offer and prepare to move on.

deadCrew.text: You collect everything of value from the ship and look for the same "unknown weapon".

event.text: There isn't any such weapon on board; the pirate was just trying to deceive you.
After a while you do find the weapon, and it turned out to be...

event.name: NEBULA_ROCK_RACIST
event.text: A Rock armoured transport nearby looks to have lost its bearings, but when you hail they grow suspicious: "Whatever life-form you are, we find you repugnant. We seek no aid. Leave. Now."

choice.text: (Rock Crewmember) Offer to lead them out of the nebula.

event.text: The Rock grudgingly transfer control of their helm to you and you steer them to a thinner part of the nebula. They're not sure what to think, but transfer over some supplies all the same.

event.name: NEBULA_MANTIS_CHOICE
event.text: Navigating the fog blind, you practically bump hulls with a Mantis ship. They hail you: "Pah! This transgression will be overlooked. Nebula, very dangerous. Next time, humans all die."

choice.text: There won't be a next time. Open fire!
This place is dangerous enough. Move on.

event.name: NEBULA_REBEL_CHASE
event.text: You spot a Rebel ship in the nebula ahead and stay off their radar. Try to engage?
You try and stay out of sight. You doubt they saw you.

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Try to track them as you move to engage.

event.text: As soon as they see you they make a run for it. You squeeze what you can out of the malfunctioning sensors and are able to keep track of them long enough to get in firing range.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Try to track them as you move to engage.

event.text: As soon as they see you they make a run for it. You squeeze what you can out of the malfunctioning sensors and are able to keep track of them long enough to get in firing range.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) Use their life signatures to follow.

event.text: Your augment's ability to keep track of their life signatures within the nebula proves useful. You catch up to the ship and prepare for a fight.
You follow their vapour trails and surf onto their six o'clock, weapons hot.
Without sensors you can't maintain a lock for long. The Rebels slip away.
You get disoriented in the nebula and lose your bearings completely. It takes some time to get back to the beacon. It's likely the fleet has had time to advance closer to your position.

event.name: NEBULA_TRADER
event.text: It's hard to see why, but this beacon is apparently a tourist destination. One of the ships at the small station is offering a deal.

You decide to attack them and give the order to charge the weapons. But whether or not they were ready to attack, they had their weapons pre-ignited — you immediately receive their volley battering your ship.
As soon as you start bringing all of your systems online for battle, they do the same.
As soon as you start bringing all of your systems online for battle, they do the same.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
You make a deal.
Together with the supplies on your ship a "Surprise" was also delivered! It was a trap, but you know that the Slugs are untrustworthy traders...
Having finished the exchange, you prepare to jump.

textList.name: NEBULA_BOARDING_TEXT
textList.text: You see a small station nearby and feel the shudder of shots ringing through the ship. You can't be sure without sensors, but it seems there may be intruders on the ship!

You arrive in the nebula and immediately receive a message from an unknown source, "Prepare to be boarded!" With the static from the nebula, there's no way to tell where they came from, but you hear shots fired on board the ship.
You see a number of derelict ships near this beacon. After a short time you hear the tell-tale sounds of a teleporter and shouts coming from within the ship. You've been boarded!

event.name: STORM_AUTO
event.text: You jump into a sector of the nebula beset by a plasma storm. An automated Rebel scout stationed at the beacon moves in to attack.
You successfully lose the ship in the storm.
By using your advanced cloaking system you easily lose your pursuer in the storm.
You successfully lose the ship in the storm.
Despite your improved engines you are unable to shake them; you turn and prepare for a fight.

event.name: STORM_REBEL
event.text: You arrive in the middle of a plasma storm. Despite the harsh conditions, a Rebel scout seems to be waiting for you.

event.name: STORM_BOARDING
event.text: You find two heavily damaged ships floating nearby, the remains of a battle. You begin to harvest some usable debris when you hear the sounds of someone beaming aboard followed by the shouts of a boarding party.

event.name: STORM_ITEMS
event.text: You jump into the middle of a plasma storm. Multiple recently incapacitated ships loom in the shadows, briefly illuminated by the lightning.

choice.text: Manually search the wreckage for survivors and equipment.
Avoid the risk and wait to jump away unscathed.
(Improved Piloting) Have your pilot carefully explore the debris.
(Advanced Piloting) Have your pilot carefully explore the debris.

event.text: Despite your caution, the lack of detection equipment allows debris to crash into your ship, damaging the hull. You salvage what you can and prepare to jump before anything worse happens.

Within the ship graveyard you find one ship that seems relatively untouched. On board you find an unconscious passenger, and take them back to the ship. Once awake they offer to join your crew in thanks.

While the crew is off the ship searching through the wrecks, two hulls crash into each other breaking the crew's tethers. You have no time to react as someone is knocked away, floating helplessly into the gaseous clouds...

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
Among the junk and scrap you find a salvageable drone schematic. You decide to quit while ahead and prepare to jump with your recent find.
Most of the debris is hardly even usable as scrap. However, you eventually find an intact weapon that can be mounted on your ship.

Within the ship graveyard you find one ship that seems relatively untouched. On board you find an unconscious passenger and take him back to the ship. Once awake they offer to join your crew in thanks.
Among the junk and scrap you find a salvageable drone schematic. You decide to quit while ahead and prepare to jump with your recent find.
Most of the debris is hardly even usable as scrap. However, you eventually find an intact weapon that can be mounted on your ship.
Your pilot carefully explores the wrecks, but the storm has taken its toll. Any crew are long-since dead and the floating debris has been scorched beyond repair.

Within the ship graveyard you find one ship that seems relatively untouched. On board you find an unconscious passenger and take him back to the ship. Once awake they offer to join your crew in thanks.
Among the junk and scrap you find a salvageable drone schematic. You decide to quit while ahead and prepare to jump with your recent find.
Most of the debris is hardly even usable as scrap. However, you eventually find an intact weapon that can be mounted on your ship.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_BURST_QUEST
event.text: The distress signal emanates from a dilapidated station, hanging still not far from the beacon. It seems that a gang of slugs worked here, but it is unlikely there are any survivors — debris hangs around everywhere.

choice.text: Collect nearby debris and fly away.

event.text: You don't risk approaching the station and only collect nearby scrap, then prepare to make the next jump.
You turn on sensors at full power but an image does not appear — the nebula here is just too dense. Having collected a bit of scrap, you fly away.
You turn on sensors at full power but an image does not appear — the nebula here is just too dense. Having collected some scrap, you fly away.

You direct the sensors in the direction of the station. At that moment one of the nearby debris flies in at full speed and crashes into the hull of your ship! You make a note in the logbook: "Do not forget to improve the sensor system."

You turn on sensors at full power and they intersect signs of life in one of the rooms! You send your crew immediately to the station, and after some time a person is brought on board. They worked as an engineer, creating the newest reduced power consumption technology for burst lasers, when they and their fellow scientists were subjected to unexpected attack by slugs. It seems that they had crept up in disguise. After the raid on the station all working weapons were stolen, but they can still be tracked by a built-in microchip.

You turn on sensors at full power and they intersect signs of life in one of the rooms! You send your crew immediately to the station, and after some time a person is brought on board. Unfortunately, they completely lost their memory and are unable to tell you anything about whatever happened here.
The survivor is pleased to join your crew.

choice.text: (Advanced Medbay) Transfer them to your Medbay.

event.text: The advanced system of your Medbay was able to restore the damaged areas of the brain responsible for memory of the victim, and they begin to remember everything. They worked as an engineer, creating the newest reduced power consumption technology for burst lasers, when they and their fellow scientists were subjected to unexpected attack by slugs. It seems that they had crept up in disguise. After the raid on the station all working weapons were stolen, but they can still be tracked by a built-in microchip.
You turn on sensors at full power but an image does not appear — the nebula here is just too dense. Having collected some scrap, you fly away.

You turn on sensors at full power and they intersect signs of life in one of the rooms! You send your crew immediately to the station, and after some time a person is brought on board. They worked as an engineer, creating the newest reduced power consumption technology for burst lasers, when they and their fellow scientists were subjected to unexpected attack by slugs. It seems that they had crept up in disguise. After the raid on the station all working weapons were stolen, but they can still be tracked by a built-in microchip.

You turn on sensors at full power and they intersect signs of life in one of the rooms! You send your crew immediately to the station, and after some time a person is brought on board. Unfortunately, they completely lost their memory and are unable to tell you anything about whatever happened here.
The survivor is pleased to join your crew.

choice.text: (Advanced Medbay) Transfer them to your Medbay.

event.text: The advanced system of your Medbay was able to restore the damaged areas of the brain responsible for memory of the victim, and they begin to remember everything. They worked as an engineer, creating the newest reduced power consumption technology for burst lasers, when they and their fellow scientists were subjected to unexpected attack by Slugs. It seems that they had crept up in disguise. After the raid on the station all working weapons were stolen, but they can still be tracked by a built-in microchip.

event.name: BURST_SLUG
event.text: Signals from the labeled burst laser container lead you to this beacon. Looks like the Slug ship has just come out from a jump, but its weapon are already charging and aimed directly at you! You need to disassemble it as quickly as possible for scrap.

destroyed.text: The enemy ship explodes, and you manage to find a surviving copy of the stolen weapon.

deadCrew.text: Having killed off the enemy crew, you manage to find a surviving copy of the stolen weapon.

textList.name: START_BEACON_AVATAR
textList.text: There isn't a single living soul in this nebula, but for some reason that doesn't calm your nerves down at all...
This nebula would not be different from other similar ones, were it not for one feature — it is inhabited by ghosts...
Avatars are often called ghosts. Perhaps their translucent nature frightens off ships from this part of the cosmos.
Avatars inhabit this nebula — artificial intelligence, holograms similar to ghosts. Even Slugs dare not venture into this place.
Rumors suggest that ghosts inhabit these parts. Like it or not, soon you'll find out for yourself.
This nebula seems suspiciously quiet, even for a nebula. Keep your guard up.
You don't like the sounds that are heard in this place from time to time... a crewman complains of constant headaches because of them.
Only Slug ships sometimes run the risk of flying into this dangerous of a nebula. The Rebels however, will stop at nothing.

textList.name: FIND_STUFF_AVATAR
textList.text: The remains of a small ship slowly drift alongside the beacon. Inside you find some supplies.
You find an abandoned space station in orbit of a large asteroid. Your crew find some supplies inside.
Right before you are the remains of a Slug cruiser. Collecting debris, you involuntarily think about the dangers of this sector.
You stumble upon a small automated scout, however, its hull is completely shattered. Apparently, it must've gotten into a serious mess. You dismantle it for spare parts.

textList.name: NEBULA_FIND_STUFF_AVATAR
textList.text: The remains of a small ship slowly drift alongside the beacon. Inside you find some supplies.
You find an abandoned space station in orbit of a large asteroid. Your crew find some supplies inside.
Right before you are the remains of a Slug cruiser. Collecting debris, you involuntarily think about the dangers of this sector.
Because of a dense cloud of nebula, the remains of a Slug cruiser slowly drift by. You collect all that's left of it.
You stumble upon a small automated scout, however, its hull is completely shattered. Apparently, it must've gotten into a serious mess. You dismantle it for spare parts.

textList.name: NEBULA_STORE_AVATAR
textList.text: Someone left an automated trade station here. Oddly enough, it functions without fault.
An automated trade station located in this cloud of the nebula offers its goods.
It's unknown who placed the automated trade station in this nebula, but it still works.
A small Slug ship offers a look at their goods. An Avatar-controlled nebula isn't the place where they would risk deceiving someone — here it's always better to have allies.

textList.name: NEBULA_BOARDING_AVATAR_TEXT
textList.text: You collect the fragments of a small space probe when several Avatars materialize on your ship with terrible sounds. The crew is hastily preparing to fend them off.
In this nebula you find a broken miner's ship with a bit of scrap in its hold. Returning with the extraction, you suddenly realize that you brought several Avatars with you!
Avatars don't let you collect all the metal hanging around the beacon. Your crew's left in horror — ghosts are aboard the ship!

textList.name: AVATAR_SHIPS_LIST
textList.text: It's not known why, but Avatar ships are always accompanied by the sounds of a siren. Hearing it again, your team gets ready to fight.
Eerie sounds suddenly interrupt the silence of the cosmos — Avatars are attacking you! Broadcasting sirens to tear at the ears of enemies is their favorite tactic.
Directly before you — an Avatar combat ship. All attempts to settle the situation peacefully are useless — they're unable to communicate with other races.
A siren's alarm is heard on your ship — Avatars are preparing to take it apart for spare parts. Ready the weapons for battle!
An Avatar battleship awaits to ambush unwary travelers at this beacon. You have no choice but to ready your defenses.
"Not another goddamn siren!" — yells a crewman in horror in the corner of their room. You calm your crew down and give the order to prepare to fight.
Near the beacon is a patrolling vessel under AI control. Noticing you, it immediately goes on the attack.
"Captain!" — a crewman hurries to you with a report. "We're under fire by those damn ghosts!" You already knew this by the terrible howl that rumbled throughout the ship.
The beacon in front of you is unremarkable, and you already give the order to leave it when an AI ship appears right ahead. Prepare to fight!
Avatars located at this beacon have already turned on their siren and are getting ready to attack. Your crew tries their hardest to block out the deafening sounds and focus on the battle at hand.

textList.name: NEBULA_AVATAR_SHIPS_LIST
textList.text: It's not known why, but Avatar ships are always accompanied by the sounds of a siren. Hearing it again, your team gets ready to fight.
Eerie sounds suddenly interrupt the silence of the cosmos — Avatars are attacking you! Broadcasting sirens to tear at the ears of enemies is their favorite tactic.
Another Avatar ship emerges from the nebula advancing directly towards you. You've no choice but to figure out how to take the fight.
Directly before you — an Avatar combat ship. All attempts to settle the situation peacefully are useless — they're unable to communicate with other races.
A siren's alarm is heard on your ship — Avatars are preparing to take it apart for spare parts. Ready the weapons for battle!
An Avatar battleship awaits to ambush unwary travelers at this beacon. You have no choice but to ready your defenses.
"Not another goddamn siren!" — yells a crewman in horror in the corner of their room. You calm your crew down and give the order to prepare to fight.
You jump next to an empty beacon. There is nothing of interest around, and you give the order to jump, when an Avatar cruiser emerges from the nebula and changes your plans.
Near the beacon is a patrolling vessel under AI control. Noticing you, it immediately goes on the attack.
The nebula is slightly dissipated in front of you, and there you see an Avatar ship coming at you in a frontal attack.
You can't make anything out in the nebula before you, when suddenly a siren is heard all over the ship. You've come under attack by Avatars!
"Captain!" — a crewman hurries to you with a report. "We're under fire by those damn ghosts!" You already knew this by the terrible howl that rumbled throughout the ship.
The beacon in front of you is unremarkable, and you already give the order to leave it when an AI ship appears right ahead. Prepare to fight!
Your crew's nerves rattle when yet another Avatar ship emerges from a cloud of nebula. A crewman tearfully runs away from their post. You somehow manage to calm down the crew.
Avatars located at this beacon have already turned on their siren and are getting ready to attack. Your crew tries their hardest to block out the deafening sounds and focus on the battle at hand.

event.text: There isn't a single Avatar left on the ship. You collect useful materials.
There isn't a single Avatar left on the ship. You take all materials that look useful.
With the Avatars gone, you can take fuel from their storage, and also collect all available scrap material.
With the Avatars gone, you can take all the fuel from their storage, and also collect all available scrap material.
You manage to kill off the entire Avatar crew. One of them can be brought back to life and reprogrammed to fight on your side.
You find a unique Avatar weapon on their ship. With no one to stop you, you safely take it for yourself.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_HELP
event.text: Turns out that the distress signal was transmitted by a Slug ship, which fell under attack by Avatars. They say that their ship is gaping with holes, and ask you for scrap to repair their hull, they don't mind how much.
You know of course that the Slugs mend holes with repair gel. They won't fool you this time.

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Scan their ship for damage.

event.text: The sensors don't detect any damage on their ship. Realizing that their deception was uncovered, the Slugs go on the attack.

choice.text: (Slug Repair Gel) Share your gel with them to seal the holes in their ship.

event.text: They don't want to say where their gel went, but they gratefully accept your help.
Soon, their ship looks just like new. One of the Slugs wants to join your crew, carrying a few fuel cells on their back.
As it turns out, their ship isn't too badly damaged at all. They answer your aggression by firing a volley at you.
As it turns out, their ship isn't too badly damaged at all. They're charging their weapons.
As soon as you give them the scrap, they hide in the nearest cloud of the nebula. Looks like you've been tricked.
Slugs take the scrap and quietly disappear into the nebula. When will you learn not to trust them?
They thank you and in response give you a ship augmentation.
They thank you and in return give you a ship augmentation and some fuel.
They thank you and in return give you a ship augmentation and some missiles.
They thank you and in return give you a ship augmentation and some drone parts.
Slugs take the scrap and quietly disappear into the nebula. When will you learn not to trust them?

They thank you and in return give you a ship augmentation and some fuel.
They thank you and in return give you a ship augmentation and some missiles.
They thank you and in return give you a ship augmentation and some drone parts.

textList.name: NEBULA_REBEL_HELP_LIST
textList.text: Disaster struck a Rebel ship, but they hardly expected that someone from the Federation would answer their distress call. It's unknown what happened to them, but they're already charging up their weapons.
Either this Rebel ship actually needs help, or it was a trap — in any case, they don't deserve anything but death.
The signal was a trap — a Rebel cruiser is waiting for you in this nebula!
The distress signal was transmitted by a Rebel cruiser, and you flew right into their trap. Prepare to fight!
It's not necessary to answer every distress call — this one's a Rebel ambush, and they're already moving in to attack.

event.name: NEBULA_REBEL_HELP2
event.text: Looks like you've landed directly in a Rebel trap — the distress signal is being transmitted by their battlecruiser! But then they hail: "Please, get us out of here! We're lost in the nebula, and these damned ghosts are driving the crew crazy!"

choice.text: Escort them to the nearest safe beacon.

event.text: You have a short conversation with the Rebels — a couple of shots in their direction makes them remember which side you are fighting on.
They follow you to the next beacon and are safely moved away from that nebula. One of them wishes to join your crew.
As soon as you fly towards them to show them the way, a volley from their weapons arrives from the stern. The treacherous Rebels deceived you!
You take them out of that nebula, and the relieved Rebels send you a reward. You fly away with a promise to tear them to shreds if they ever encounter you again.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_HELP2
event.text: Some Slugs — unknown how they ended up here — got stuck on this beacon without fuel. They promise to pay with scrap if you help them get out of here.
You send them the fuel, and they immediately jump away! Once again, you have fallen for classic Slug bait...
You send them the fuel, and they give you scrap.
You send them the fuel, and they give you scrap.
"You'll regret that..." — the last thing you hear before they cut communications.

choice.text: Decline and prepare to move on.

event.text: You've never trusted the Slugs and see no reason to do so now, and give the order to make the next jump.

event.name: NEBULA_SLUG_DEAD
event.text: While you were jumping to the beacon, the distress signal was interrupted. Because of the dense nebula around, you can't pinpoint its source.
There's nothing more you can do here, so you get ready to jump.
Your sensors aren't powerful enough to find anything here. Nothing remains, except to continue your mission and move on.

After a few minutes of scanning, you finally spot a wrecked Slug ship. Inside, you find no one at all. Riddled with breaches, tt looks like the hull depressurized and blew right out into open space. You take everything you can from the broken ship.

After a few minutes of scanning, you finally spot a wrecked Slug ship. The sole surviving Slug joins your crew, and you take everything you can from the broken ship.

event.name: NEBULA_AVATAR_HELP
event.text: Surprisingly, the distress signal is transmitted by an Avatar ship! They don't hurry to attack you, but don't answer your hails either.
Once you activate your weaponry, the Avatar ship comes to life and starts charging its own.
You decide not to run into trouble and prepare to jump away.

choice.text: (Avatar Crewmember) Have your Avatar hail them.

event.text: Although your Avatar cannot communicate with you, they still understand what's required of them. For some time they disappear and reappear on the AI ship. You don't really understand what they did there, but the ship sends you a capsule with a weapon inside in gratitude. However, "gratitude" may not be the right word to use when referring to artificial intelligence.

Although your Avatar cannot communicate with you, they still understand what's required of them. For some time they disappear and reappear on the AI ship. You don't really understand what they did there, but the ship sends you a capsule with an augmentation inside in gratitude. However, "gratitude" may not be the right word to use when referring to artificial intelligence.

event.name: NEBULA_AVATAR_HELP2
event.text: The distress signal turned out to be a trap — you have to fight an AI ship right in the middle of a plasma storm!

event.name: NEBULA_AVATAR_HELP3
event.text: The distress call leads you straight into a pulsar, near which an AI ship is waiting for you. It's a trap!

event.name: NEBULA_MOTHERSHIP
event.text: Today your ship's pretty unlucky. You flew straight into a trap, set up by a phantom dreadnought! Not every distress signal needs to be answered...

destroyed.text: The ghost dreadnought's destroyed. You collect its fragments and among them you find a surviving Avatar weapon.

deadCrew.text: The ghost dreadnought's crew's been annihilated. You take everything of value from the ship, including a surviving Avatar weapon.

event.name: NEBULA_AI_KILLS_CIV
event.text: The distress call was transmitted by a heavily battered civilian vessel. Ghosts attacked their trade convoy, and although the civilians managed to escape, on one of the ships, its built-in artificial intelligence system went insane and tried to kill its own crew by seizing control of the ship and mind controlling them. If you manage to damage the ship's AI very strongly, before their crew dies, they promise to thank you.

choice.text: A trade convoy, in this sector? That sounds far from the truth, attack them!

event.text: The civilians send curses your way, but are preparing to defend themselves, despite their damage.

choice.text: Go to the captured ship and try to disable the AI with the help of several volleys.

event.text: With your approach, the ship activates its armament, disconnecting its life support systems! You'll need to hurry and stop it while their ship still has oxygen.
The civilians begin to suffocate...

choice.text: Don't interfere and get ready to fly away.

event.text: The ship captured by the artificial intelligence soon jumps away somewhere into the nebula, and the civilians beside you patch up the holes in their hull.

surrender.text: Apparently, the ship's AI disconnected and lost its control over the ship's systems and crew.

event.text: You stop just in time, and the people freed from the mind control immediately rush to put on oxygen masks. Approaching, the civilians shower you with gratitude for saving their comrades and give you a weapon from their holds.
Disassemble them for scrap metal — the only true solution to this situation.

destroyed.text: You completely destroy the civilian ship, and their comrades will obviously not thank you for its obliteration. However, no one bothers you while you profit from its remains.

deadCrew.text: The crew of the target is dead, and the ship's AI disconnected, apparently, having fulfilled its purpose. You convince the civilians that you did all that could — though evidently not enough — and they fly away embittered, leaving you to collect everything of value from the captured ship.

surrender.text: The civilians get in touch: "I beg you, stop! We'll give you everything we've got! "

event.text: They send you a container with cargo.

choice.text: This is not enough, demand more.

event.text: Again cursing you, they send a little scrap. It seems that they have nothing more for you to take, so you get ready to fly away.
"How could you, you promised not to attack?!" says their captain, almost crying. Well, what can you do, in these difficult times you have no other choice.

escape.text: You register that their ship is charging their FTL Drive.

gotaway.text: The ship jumped away somewhere into the depths of the nebula, and you don't risk pursuing them.

destroyed.text: The civilian ship explodes, and you collect the debris from its remains.

deadCrew.text: With their crew dead, you clean out their holds.
